a:r.a:t: With all the online crimes being committed today, people are concerned. There are simply a lot of data that consumers have that, if not properly protected, could be used by criminals to carry out unauthorized financial transactions.

There are obviously the usernames and passwords—the account credentials, those login security questions and answers—especially ones for our financial accounts—that need to be protected, but that’s just a part of it.

We also need to make sure bad guys don’t have access to our SSNs date of birthday, driver’s license info, healthcare records, home addresses, and so forth—because the more information they get their hands on, the more likely they will be able to impersonate us and conduct authorized transactions.
The more people can do to secure and protect their data—the so called PII data—the less likely they will be victims.
